text: Keith Max Jackson (October 18, 1928 â€“ January 12, 2018) was an American sportscaster. He was known for his coverage of college football games. ==Early life== Jackson was born Keith Max Jackson in Roopville, Georgia on October 18, 1928. He served in the military of the United States during the Cold War. He studied at Washington State University. In 1952, he married Turi Ann Johnsen. ==Career== Jackson was known for his career with ABC Sports (1966-2006), his intelligent yet folksy coverage of college football (1952-2006), and his distinctive voice, with its deep cadence and operatic tone said to be "like Edward R. Murrow reporting on World War II, the voice of ultimate authority in college football."Broadcaster Keith Jackson set to retire , The Sporting News, April 27, 2006. ==Death== On January 12, 2018, Jackson died in Sherman Oaks, Los Angeles, California at the age of 89.Legendary Broadcaster Keith Jackson Dies at 89 ==References== ==Other websites== * ABC profile * Category:1928 births Category:2018 deaths Category:American radio personalities Category:American television personalities Category:Sportspeople from Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Keith Jackson
